channel.title: Variables/Parameters in python query runner
channel.description:
I have a parameter `date_range`. When I use the same in a python query runner, I get an error.
```py print({{ date_range.start }}) ```
Error running query: **<class 'SyntaxError'> ("Line 1: SyntaxError: invalid token at statement: 'print(2022-05-22)'",)**
I have tried using `"{{ date_range.start }}"` as well, to no avail. Any help?

item.title: Variables/Parameters in python query runner
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
Just curious: what’s the purpose of a print statement in this query? Do you see this rendered output somewhere?

Read full topic

item.title: Variables/Parameters in python query runner
item.dc:creator: s7dhansh
item.description:
I have a parameter date_range. When I use the same in a python query runner, I get an error.

print({{ date_range.start }})

Error running query: <class ‘SyntaxError’> (“Line 1: SyntaxError: invalid token at statement: ‘print(2022-05-22)’”,)

I have tried using "{{ date_range.start }}" as well, to no avail.
Any help?

Read full topic
